meta_description: HuKi is an Android-based hiking map for hikers that shows national hiking trails, is capable of route planning and GPX trail display.
slider_message: HuKi is a free hiking map for hikers and nature enthusiasts that integrates with hiking trails across Hungary. The main goal of the project is to help on our trips and to promote the exploration of Hungary’s beautiful landscapes. HuKi is free, ad-free, and open-source software.
features_hiking_trails_desc: The application uses the classic Hungarian Hike layer with the national hiking trails, which is integrated with the base map.
features_layers_desc: The application has several base map layers, such as Mapnik, OpenTopo, TuHu, Google Satellite, Merretekerjek.hu.
features_route_planner_desc: With the route planner, we can plan routes on hiking trails. The application estimates the length and time of the tour and creates a GPX file.
features_gpx_desc: With HuKi, GPX files can be imported and displayed on the map. The app provides distance, time estimation, and elevation coloring.
features_landscapes_desc: HuKi shows the hungarian landscapes on a map view, with their associated popular excursion places and hiking collections.
features_okt_desc: For blue trail hikers, a feature is available where the OKT, RPDDK, AKT blue rail sections and stamp locations can also be viewed.
faq_ios_title: Will there be an iOS version, when will it be available for iPhones?
faq_ios_desc: Currently, there is no iOS version of the application, but I have already started the preparations. If I had to guess, a usable version with reduced functionality could be ready by the end of 2026.
faq_offline_desc: It has a cache based offline mode. Every loaded map tile is placed in a 14-day database that can be used offline. In my experience, this method covers most cases: in the parking lot or during a hike, there is almost always enough internet to download the necessary tiles, so we don't even notice momentary interruptions.
faq_full_offline_title: Will there be a full-offline mode with a pre-downloadable map?
faq_full_offline_desc: Many of you have asked for this, so it is definitely a priority. With the current raster rendering engine, this would not be very efficient, as it would require downloading several GB of data for the entire map of Hungary. I am considering several solutions, such as smaller area-based downloads or using a vector rendering engine.
contact_message: I develop the application as a hobby in my free time and I am particularly happy to receive personal feedback, my goal is for the app to be useful to others too!
